bibl.title: Isis and Sarapis at Kellis: A Brief Note.
bibl.note: Cult images or votive offerings from the Main Temple of Tutu (lifesize stone figure of Isis, plaster sculptures of Isis lactans and Isis-Demeter, stone bust of Sarapis, painting of Isis upon a wooden panel) provide new material for the study of the cults and the arts in Egypt during the Roman period.
bibl.seg: HOPE Colin A., Isis and Sarapis at Kellis: A Brief Note.

Cult images or votive offerings from the Main Temple of Tutu (lifesize stone figure of Isis, plaster sculptures of Isis lactans and Isis-Demeter, stone bust of Sarapis, painting of Isis upon a wooden panel) provide new material for the study of the cults and the arts in Egypt during the Roman period.
